title: Christian Bale takes son Joseph, 5, on a tandem bicycle ride to the beach
text:
He's been busy on the publicity trail promoting his new movie Le Mans 66 - and was accompanied by his wife and children to the film's recent Paris premiere.

And Christian Bale, 45, was spotted enjoying some downtime on Sunday, when he took his five-year-old son Joseph for a tandem bicycle ride in Venice, California.

Looking casually cool in navy shorts with a matching T-shirt, the Welsh-born actor led the way while his adorable followed on a special attachment.

Having a wheelie good time: Christian Bale was spotted taking his five-year-old son Joseph for a bicycle ride in Venice, California, on Sunday

Putting safety first, Christian ensured that Joseph wore a helmet as he pedalled and held onto his own set of handlebars.

Earlier this month, Batman star Christian was joined by his wife Sibi Blažić, 49, and their two children at the Paris unveiling of his new movie Le Mans 66.

Donning a suave all black ensemble the Oscar-winning actor looked dapper as he greeted fans alongside co-star Matt Damon.

In the navy: Looking casually cool in navy shorts with a matching T-shirt, the Welsh-born actor led the way while his adorable followed on a special attachment

The British actor's wife and son Joseph appeared to have matched their outfits to his.

Sibi, who has been married to Christian for almost two decades, opted for a fitted knee-length black dress and wore her brown hair down.

Joseph looked equally smart in a black shirt and trousers, just like his father, and was seen sweetly holding his mother's hand as they arrived at the premiere.

Christian and Sibi's teenager daughter Emmaline, 14, wore a pretty pink ruffled dress which had a statement black bow on the front.

Family support: Earlier this month, Christian's wife Sibi Blažić and their two children, including son Joseph, accompanied him to the Paris premiere of his new movie Le Mans 66

Proud: His daughter Emmaline Bale wore a pretty pink dress to her father's Paris premiere

Christian and Matt's upcoming film tells the story of British driver Ken Miles and car designer Carroll Shelby.

The pair teamed up to create a race car for Ford Motor Company which could take on the dominating vehicles of Enzo Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

Although known as Le Mans 66 in the UK, the film will be called Ford v Ferrari in America. It is set for international release on November 15.

The race, which still exists today, is the world's oldest active sports car race in endurance racing, held annually since 1923 near the town of Le Mans, France.
